Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video actually shows a training exercise at Blaise Diagne International Airport in Senegal, not passengers infected with coronavirus on an Ethiopian Airlines flight from Italy to Addis Ababa airport.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that most of the passengers on the flight are infected with the virus, without any evidence to support this.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting a misleading interpretation of the video and attributing it to a specific flight and location.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a viral video without any additional evidence or verification.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video shows passengers infected with coronavirus, without verifying the authenticity or context of the video.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider or acknowledge the alternative explanation that the video is a training exercise at Blaise Diagne International Airport in Senegal.
